io.sysmo.nchecks

Class Reply

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sysmo.nchecks.Reply

  • public class Reply
extends java.lang.Object
    The Reply class contain all the values and data related to the execution of a module implementing NCheckInterface (a check module).
    See Also:
    Query

      void setStatusCode(int statusCode)
      The status code is used to determine if the event should be logged to the event database when two subsequent checks have the same status The default status code is 0 Here are the rules concerning "status" ans "statusCode": - All status move (ie: from OK to ERROR...) are logged

    • Constructor Detail

        public Reply()

    • Method Detail

      • setStatusCode

        public void setStatusCode(int statusCode)
        The status code is used to determine if the event should be logged to the event database when two subsequent checks have the same status The default status code is 0 Here are the rules concerning "status" ans "statusCode": - All status move (ie: from OK to ERROR...) are logged. - If two (or more) consecutive returns have the same status (CRITICAL for example) and the same statusCode, only the first event will be logged. - If two (or more) consecutive returns have the same status (CRITICAL for example) and a different statusCode, every event where a statusCode have changed will be logged.
        Parameters:
        statusCode - integer representing the status code

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
        Set the status code for this reply (see setStatusCode). The default value is 0.
        Returns:
        the actual status code.
        See Also:
        setStatusCode(int)

      • setReply

        public void setReply(java.lang.String str)
        Set the reply string of this check. It should be a human readable string.
        Parameters:
        str - the string representing the reply.

      • getReply

      • setState

        public void setState(java.io.Serializable value)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Store a state for this probe for later calls. The object will be available in the next queries with Query#getState().
        Parameters:
        value - the Object to be stored
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Query.getState()

      • pushState

        public void pushState(java.lang.String key)
        For internal use only. This function is called by NChecks with an unique key for you.
        Parameters:
        key - unique key identifying the probe
        See Also:
        Query.getState()

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(Status status)
        Set the return status.
        Parameters:
        status - A return status (Status.{ERROR|OK|WARNING|CRITICAL})
        See Also:
        setStatusCode(int)

      • getStatus

        public Status getStatus()
        Get the return status.

      • putPerformance

        public void putPerformance(java.lang.String key,
                  long value)
        Store a performance value. These performances values will be interpreted by rrd as defined in your module xml definition file. Assume there is only one rrd file (with multiple databases) to update.
        Parameters:
        key - the rrd database name
        value - the value to store

      • putPerformance

        public void putPerformance(java.lang.String group,
                  java.lang.String key,
                  long value)
        Store a performance value. These performances values will be interpreted by rrd as defined in your module xml definition file. The "group" String is used to identify one of the rrd files to update. Assume a setup with multiple rrd files.
        Parameters:
        group - the performance group key
        key - the key
        value - the value

      • putPerformance

        public void putPerformance(int group,
                  java.lang.String key,
                  long value)
        Will call putPerformance(Integer.toString(group),key...)
        Parameters:
        group - the performance group key
        key - the key
        value - the value

      • asTuple

        public com.ericsson.otp.erlang.OtpErlangTuple asTuple()
        Internal use only for NChecksErlang. Return the erlang representation of the Reply.
